pages.text: Arandaspis is a primitive jawless fish whose name comes from a local aboriginal tribe, the Aranda(also called the Arrernte). It was about 15cm long and had a streamlined body covered in rows of armored scutes. The front of the body and head were protected by hard plates with openings for eyes, nostrils and gills. It was probably a filter feeder.
